1. INTERMEDIATE QUESTIONS

What year did you start homesteading in eastern Canada? 1859

Where did you settle? 20-15-5 W & R

There had you been living before that? Out of limits

For how many years did you operate there? 10 months

How far was it to your nearest store? 10 miles

How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a month

What crops did you usually grow in those earliest years? Potatoes, oats, corn

In what quantities did you buy? 100 lbs at a time

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour?

How much did you use of whole flour?

Was flour milled locally? Yes

What was the price for a twenty pound barrel of rolled oats? 65¢

What other grain products did you use?

Cornmeal

1. INTERVIEWING

What year did you start homesteading in New Mexico? 1894
Where did you get your homestead? 2.4 - 15 - 5 N & W
How many people did you have at first? 6
How far was it to your nearest store? 10 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a month
What crops did you usually grow? In those early years, we grew corn, beans, and potatoes.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of wheat flour did you use in the early years? Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs. at a time
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of wheat flour?
How much did you use each year? 100 lbs. per year
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal
Did you grind your own flour? Yes
How did you grind it? With a small hand mill

*we made flour by hand
